intro: Hieracium stelligerum proles albogilvum, commonly known as the white-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while the stems are erect and can be branched. The species is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, where it can become invasive in certain environments.
